definition: surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image

sentences.english: Definitive stamps can be reprinted as necessary.
sentences.chinese: 普通郵票可根據需要重印。

sentences.english: I am told that one of my articles has been reprinted in the magazine.
sentences.chinese: 有人告訴我我的一篇文章已在那家雜誌上重印再版。

sentences.english: The latter often provides a glossier finish.
sentences.chinese: 後者往往提供了整理重印。

sentences.english: The QS regulation is reprinted in the appendix of this manual.
sentences.chinese: 在本手冊的附錄中重印了質量體系法規。

sentences.english: New and reprints of poetry and prose .
sentences.chinese: 新的和重印的詩歌和散文。

sentences.english: The book was reprinted frequently and five of the original edition still exist.
sentences.chinese: 這本書經常被重印，第一版的五部也被保存了下來。

sentences.english: The material is divided into chapters consisting of reprints related to a single major topic.
sentences.chinese: 這種材料是分成重印相關的一個主要議題組成的章節。

sentences.english: The snow reprints it, as it were, in clear white type alto-relievo.
sentences.chinese: 雪重印了它，就像是在白色清楚的高浮雕裏。

sentences.english: Archive Trap is almost always going to be free with fetch lands being reprinted.
sentences.chinese: 找地地重印後，檔案陷阱幾乎總是可以被免費使用。
她的暢銷小說正在重印中。

sentences.english: They decided to make all the defective sheets up.
sentences.chinese: 他們決定重印全部有缺陷的印張。

sentences.english: Don't bug private conversations, and don't buy papers that reprint them.
sentences.chinese: 不要竊聽私人談話，不要購買重印這些談話的報紙。

definition: the amount of books etc printed at one impression/print run
to set in print/to diffuse/to publish
to revise and enlarge (a book)/to augment a purchase order
to go to press/to submit for printing
